    Slocum Gliders

    Dan Kelley (https://orcid.org/0000-0001-7808-5911)

    2023-07-12

    slocum_glider.Rmd

    Abstract. This vignette explains the basics of using the oceanglider package on Slocum data. It is a work in progress, because the functions provided by this package are under active development.

    library(oceanglider)
file <- "~/data/gass/sbloom2023/batray-2023-03-17-delayed_trajectory_file.nc"
g <- read.glider.slocum.netcdf(file)
lon <- g[["longitude"]]
lat <- g[["latitude"]]
data("coastlineWorldFine", package="ocedata")
plot(coastlineWorldFine, span=450,
    clatitude=mean(lat, na.rm=TRUE), clongitude=mean(lon, na.rm=TRUE))
points(lon, lat, cex=0.5, pch=20, col=2)
data(topoWorld)
contour(topoWorld[["longitude"]], topoWorld[["latitude"]],
    -topoWorld[["z"]], level=500, add=TRUE, labcex=0.9)
    Glider surfaced locations (red dots) with 500m depth contour (black line)

    Developed by Dan Kelley, Clark Richards, Chantelle Layton.

    Site built with pkgdown 2.0.7.
